intro: Guatteria caniflora, commonly known as the sharp-leaved guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually革质 (leathery) and have a distinct, serrated edge, contributing to its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by edible, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
